synopsis.text: World War II has left young Mahito devastated, grieving the loss of his mother during a Tokyo air raid. He moves to the tranquil countryside with his father and new stepmother, Natsuko, who bears a striking resemblance to his late mother. Struggling to adapt to his new life, Mahito encounters a peculiar gray heron that lures him into a mysterious tower. The heron claims that Mahito's mother is alive within the tower, and so Mahito embarks on an extraordinary journey to uncover the truth about his mother and himself. Along the way, he discovers a fantastical world that blends life and death, where he must navigate its secrets to find his missing stepmother and understand the true essence of being human. This captivating tale, inspired by a 1937 literary masterpiece, explores themes of spiritual growth, loss, and the complexities of life.
